snippet: The prosecutor said that five teenagers accused of overturning as many as 250 gravestones in a Jewish cemetery confessed and made pro-Nazi remarks.
abstract: French prosecutor Philippe Vannier says five teenagers arrested for overturning as many as 250 gravestones in Jewish cemetery in eastern France had clear anti-Semitic motive.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor said that five teenagers accused of overturning as many as 250 gravestones in a Jewish cemetery confessed and made pro-Nazi remarks.

headline.main: French Cemetery Vandalism Suspects Acted With ‘Anti-Semitic Motive,’ Prosecutor Says
headline.print_headline: France: Prosecutor Says Teenagers Confessed to Defiling Jews’ Graves
